intro: Psoralea bituminosa subvar. ovata, commonly known as the broad-leafed psoralea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in racemes, and the subvariety ovata is distinguished by its broader leaf shape compared to other variants. It plays a role in local ecosystems and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
